message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class Calculator {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String input = "3+3";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, "+");
        double num1 = Double.parseDouble(st.nextToken());
        double num2 = Double.parseDouble(st.nextToken());
        double result = num1 + num2;
        System.out.println("First Number: " + num1);
        System.out.println("Operation: +");
        System.out.println("Second Number: " + num2);
        System.out.println("Result: " + result);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using the StringTokenizer class to split the input string into tokens using the "+" sign as the delimiter. The nextToken() method is used to get the next token from the StringTokenizer object. We then parse these tokens into double values using the Double.parseDouble() method. The result is then calculated by adding the two numbers together. The result, along with the input numbers and the operation, are then printed out.
